items.title: Carragher heeft geen medelijden met Amorim: 'Het had niet slechter gekund'
items.summary: Na 63 wedstrijden is Ruben Amorim de laan uitgestuurd bij Manchester United, maar dat had volgens Jamie Carragher al veel eerder kunnen gebeuren. De voormalig topverdediger van Liverpool heeft bepaald geen medelijden met de Portugese oefenmeester, die volgens hem niet slechter had kunnen presteren.

items.title: Sources: Man Utd eye interim until summer
items.summary: Manchester United are leaning towards installing an interim coach to replace Ruben Amorim until the end of the season, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Sources: United sacked Amorim after Wilcox row
items.summary: Ruben Amorim was sacked by Manchester United in the aftermath of an explosive meeting with director of football Jason Wilcox on Friday, sources have confirmed to ESPN.

items.title: Man City's Gvardiol to have surgery on broken leg

items.title: Liam Rosenior confirmed as Chelsea head coach on contract to 2032
items.summary: He arrives from Strasbourg to replace Enzo Maresca ‚ÄòI cannot turn down Chelsea,‚Äô says former Hull coach Liam Rosenior has been confirmed as Chelsea‚Äôs head coach on a contract to 2032, describing the opportunity to replace Enzo Maresca at Stamford Bridge as one he could not turn down. Rosenior has left Strasbourg, Chelsea‚Äôs partner club, after holding talks over the role on Monday. He said at a Strasbourg press conference on Tuesday: ‚ÄúI have had interest from many clubs, including Champions League clubs, which I have always been open with to [our president] Marc [Keller] and our ownership. I will love this club for the rest of my life but I cannot turn down Chelsea.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: West Brom sack Ryan Mason as head coach after 10th straight away defeat
items.summary: Mason was appointed in June on three-year contract West Brom 18th in the Championship after latest loss West Brom have sacked Ryan Mason as their head coach after a stoppage-time defeat at Leicester on Monday left the club 18th in the Championship. It was the team‚Äôs 10th away defeat in a row and ended the 34-year-old‚Äôs tenure after seven months. Mason was appointed on a three-year deal after holding a variety of roles at Tottenham, including interim manager and assistant to Ange Postecoglou. West Brom said two members of Mason‚Äôs staff, Nigel Gibbs and Sam Pooley, had also left. Continue reading...

items.title: Why Man United sacked Amorim: Basic tactics, player issues, transfer frustration
items.summary: Ruben Amorim was seen as a risky choice to lead Man United's rebuild in November 2024, and ultimately, it didn't work out with news of Monday's firing. Here's how things broke down publicly and behind closed doors.

items.title: From academy to Champions League: next manager‚Äôs Manchester United in-tray
items.summary: Club must learn to play without fear and harness their young players, particularly Kobbie Mainoo, and regain a seat at Europe‚Äôs top table Whatever the protestations from Manchester United about the relationship between Ruben Amorim and the higher-ups not collapsing like a house of cards, clearly something was not right. The head coach became increasingly open that something was amiss after chats with Jason Wilcox. The director of football has not covered himself in glory at the club, but he and the chief executive, Omar Berrada, remain while another head coach departs. Conversations with potential replacements need to centre on everyone being on the same page. There were disagreements over tactics and recruitment, which created tension Old Trafford could ill afford. Nothing will be fixed overnight, meaning the incoming coach needs explicit guidelines on what is required and must offer a clear path on how tactics and style will meet expectations. Season-by-season ambitions should be set, allowing everyone to be held accountable, instead of the blame being foisted on one man. Continue reading...

items.title: ‚ÄòThese guys are like family to me‚Äô: behind the scenes with Wolves‚Äôs kitman
items.summary: Sean Ruiz and his team reveal the kit preparations and dressing room routines that make the players tick Sean Ruiz always leaves his training-ground office door wide open. He is no fan of enclosed spaces, but there is much more to it. The passing Wolves defender Yerson Mosquera spots Ruiz and pops in for a brief chat with a fellow Colombian. Minutes later an under-21s player seeks Ruiz‚Äôs counsel on a non-footballing matter. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a blessing to have these relationships,‚Äù Ruiz says. ‚ÄúTo see them not just for what everybody else sees: a centre-back, a striker for Wolves. These guys are like family to me. I‚Äôm lucky to get to see this side of them, to be there when things are good, when things are bad. We‚Äôre not just players and staff here. It‚Äôs something more.‚Äù Continue reading...
